titleStmt.title: Letter from Ron Hull to John Neihardt, September 13, 1961
titleStmt.author: Hull, Ronald Eugene, 1930-

publicationStmt.authority: The Papers of John G. Neihardt

distributor.name: Center for Digital Research in the Humanities

bibl.author: Hull, Ronald Eugene, 1930-
bibl.title: Letter from Ron Hull to John G. Neihardt

revisionDesc.change: Weakly, Laura K. Proofreading and Encoding
Struble, Keegan Transcription and Initial Encoding

div1.p: You have truly been a bright spot in our lives here at KUON-TV. Thank you so much for taking the time to give us the benefit of your philosophy, personality and talent. We are extremely pleased with the three programs we have featuring you, and it is my hope to do one more when you are here for the dedication. Probably the happiest combination I can think of for television would be a program featuring you and Mari Sandoz talking together. She is going to be here in late October, so if this coincides at all with the dedication perhaps something can be worked out.
A check will be sent to you as soon as it has cleared the University red tape.You know how that is.In many ways working for a university is much like being in the army, don't you think?
It was wonderful having the opportunity of knowing you Dr. Neihardt. I am looking forward to seeing you when next you come to Lincoln.
div1.closer:
Cordially,
Ron Hull Program Manager
RH:wq
